Title: Cocoa farmers seek inclusion in AU cocoa development plan
Summary: Women cocoa farmers in Ondo State have called on the federal and state governments to ensure their inclusion in the African Cocoa Agenda 2063 .

Title: Why I left Annie — 2Baba
Summary: Innocent Idibia, widely known as 2Baba, has broken his silence on his separation from his wife, Annie Macaulay, after over a decade of marriage . The 49-year-old music icon spoke during a recent episode of the 234 Mzansi show .

Title: How interests, overlapping roles may undermine new tax regime
Summary: Less than a week after the much-expected tax retooling laws were signed, there are rising concerns that the ambitious objectives of the reforms could be derailed by entrenched political structures, vested interests and coordinated failure .

Title: PDP upbeat on party’s prospects after NEC meeting, okays Anyanwu’s reinstatement
Summary: Leaders of the Peoples Democratic Party expressed optimism about the party’s prospects after NEC meeting . Some analysts viewed the NEC meeting as a make-or-break National Executive Committee meeting .

Title: How Shettima stoked APC’s early NEC meeting
Summary: Three critical issues prompted the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) to schedule an early National Executive Committee (NEC) meeting, findings show . Shettima stoked APC’s early NEC meeting .

Title: Nigeria’s economy sustained by services sector —ICSAN
Summary: Institute of Chartered Secretaries and Administrators of Nigeria attributed growth to the services sector . Outgoing President of the Institute, Funmi Ekundayo, disclosed this during her valedictory media parley held in Lagos .

Title: Foreign portfolio investments rise 88.5% to N118.9bn
Summary: May 2025 figure rose by 88.5% to N118.91 billion . April figure was N63.07 billion . This was partly supported by moderating fixed income yields and improved market sentiment .

Title: Banks’ deposits with CBN soar 907% to N68.9trn
Summary: Banks’ deposits with CBN soar 907.3 percent to N68.9 trillion in the first half of the year (H1’25) from N6.84 trillion . CBN accepts deposits from banks through its Standing Deposit Deposit Scheme .

Title: Troops neutralize 10 Boko Haram terrorists in fierce gun battle at Nigeria-Cameroon border
Summary: Troops neutralize 10 Boko Haram terrorists in fierce encounter at Nigeria-Cameroon border . Combined troops of Theatre Command, Operation Hadin Kai and Multinational Joint Task Force have neutralized 10 terrorists . The encounter took place along Road Rann - Gamboru Ngala axis .

Title: ‘Over 25 million naturalised Americans at risk as U.S. begins revoking citizenship’
Summary: U.S. Department of Justice has instructed attorneys in its civil division to prioritise denaturalisation proceedings against naturalised citizens found to have committed certain offences .

Title: Saudi's Al Hilal knock out Man City in 4–3 Club World Cup thriller
Summary: Al-Hilal beat Manchester City 4-3 in extra-time to reach the last 16 of the World Cup . The match finished 2-2 at full-time but City had plenty of chances to extend their lead before the break . The result was the first time the English side had taken the lead in the quarter-finals

Title: Teachers to jostle for N51m Maltina prize
Summary: The Nigerian Breweries-Felix Ohiwerei Education Trust Fund launched the call for entries for the 11th edition of the competition in Lagos . Entries are open from June 24 to August 22, with eligible teachers expected to visit the dedicated Maltina Teacher of the Year website to complete the entry form online .

Title: Ex-General rejects emergency rule for North
Summary: The security situation in the North can be effectively addressed through strong political will and commitment from the central government rather than declaring a state of emergency . This was the view of Brig-Gen Kapeh Alwali Kazir (Retd.), during an exclusive interview with Arewa PUNCH in Damaturu, while responding to the

Title: MTN backs Borno schools’ digital literacy agenda with tablet
Summary: Each of the 15 schools in the state will receive 750 tablets . The distribution of the tablets is a total of 750 . It is a symbolic gesture for the state of Nigeria .

Title: ECOWAS parliament seeks legal framework for AI in West Africa
Summary: The Speaker of the ECOWAS Parliament, Hadja Ibrahima, has called for a strong legal framework for Artificial Intelligence development across West Africa . She made the call at a meeting of the parliament’s Joint Committee on Education, Science, Culture, Health, Telecommunications and Information Technology in Dakar, Senegal, on Monday .
